notes.title: Motivation Theories: Maslow vs. Herzberg
notes.content: Contrast content vs. hygiene–motivator views; use in job design. Typical exam: compare assumptions, managerial implications, and how to combine them in practice.
keyTakeaways: Herzberg: enrich jobs to add motivators; hygiene fixes only remove dissatisfaction.
Maslow: lower needs first; growth needs sustain motivation.
Practical: ensure hygiene then add autonomy, mastery, purpose.

resources.title: Herzberg PDF (reprint scan)
resources.description: Original text used in HBR reprints

notes.title: McGregor's Theory X & Theory Y (Assumptions → Structure)
notes.content: Manager assumptions shape control vs. empowerment. Link to decentralization, performance management, and culture.
keyTakeaways: Theory X → tight controls, extrinsic rewards.
Theory Y → autonomy, development, intrinsic drivers.
Align HR, structure, and leadership style with assumptions.

resources.title: McGregor — The Human Side of Enterprise (extract)

notes.title: Leadership Theories: Trait, Behavioral, Contingency
notes.content: Compare Ohio/Michigan, Blake & Mouton, Fiedler, Path–Goal. Typical exam asks to apply to case or contrast models.
keyTakeaways: No single best style: contingency fit matters.
Differentiate task vs. relationship behaviors.
Use situational cues: follower readiness, task structure.

notes.title: Organizational Structure & Culture
notes.content: Mechanistic vs. organic; functional/divisional/matrix; culture layers and artifacts.
keyTakeaways: Structure follows strategy and environment.
Culture aligns behaviors with strategy; artifacts reflect espoused values.
Boundaryless & networked forms suit dynamic markets.

notes.title: Planning & Control Cycle
notes.content: Vision→Goals→Plans→Implementation→Control (feedback).
keyTakeaways: MBO links individual targets to org goals.
KPIs must be SMART; control uses feedforward, concurrent, feedback.
Budgetary & non-financial controls complement each other.

notes.title: Marketing Concept vs. Selling Concept
notes.content: Shift from pushing products to meeting needs via STP + 4/7Ps.
keyTakeaways: Marketing focuses on value creation and relationships.
Selling emphasizes transactions; risk of short-termism.
STP precedes tactical mix.

notes.title: Marketing Mix & Product Life Cycle
notes.content: Adapt product, price, place, promotion across PLC stages; consider services (7Ps).
keyTakeaways: Intro: awareness & trial; Growth: differentiation; Maturity: defense; Decline: harvest/exit.
Services require People, Process, Physical Evidence.
Positioning consistency is critical.

notes.title: Global & International Marketing
notes.content: Entry modes: exporting, licensing, JV, FDI; standardize vs. adapt.
keyTakeaways: Trade-off: economies of scale vs. local responsiveness.
PESTLE and cultural distance matter.
Channels & pricing sensitive to regulatory context.

notes.title: Financial Ratios: Liquidity, Solvency, Profitability
notes.content: Compute & interpret Current, Quick, D/E, ROE/ROA, Turnover.
keyTakeaways: Use multiple ratios; trend and peer comparison are essential.
Quick ratio excludes inventory; D/E varies by industry.
Link ratios to working capital strategy.

notes.title: Time Value of Money, NPV & IRR
notes.content: Present value basics; NPV as value-add criterion; IRR as return metric (with limitations).
keyTakeaways: Prefer NPV for mutually exclusive projects.
Use XIRR for irregular cash flows.
Beware multiple IRRs and scale/timing issues.

notes.title: Working Capital & Cash Conversion Cycle
notes.content: Policies (aggressive, moderate, conservative); CCC drivers: DIO, DSO, DPO.
keyTakeaways: Tighter CCC improves liquidity but may affect relationships.
Match financing to asset maturities.
Monitor seasonality and credit policy.

notes.title: EOQ & Inventory Cost Trade-offs
notes.content: EOQ minimizes ordering + holding cost under steady demand; variants for shortages/quantity discounts.
keyTakeaways: Base formula: EOQ = √(2SD/H).
Assumptions often violated—forecast & variability matter.
Integrate with reorder point & safety stock.

notes.title: Supply Chain Drivers & Bullwhip Effect
notes.content: Facilities, inventory, transportation, information; demand amplification and countermeasures.
keyTakeaways: Bullwhip increases cost, lowers service.
Mitigate via information sharing, coordination, smaller batch sizes.
Align incentives across echelons.

resources.title: MIT SMR — Bullwhip Effect (Lee et al.)

notes.title: Forecasting & Demand Management
notes.content: Qualitative vs. quantitative methods; error metrics (MAPE, RMSE); CPFR.
keyTakeaways: Combine methods; track bias and variance.
Collaborative planning reduces distortions.
Link forecast to capacity & inventory.

resources.title: MIT OCW — Intro SCM lecture notes

notes.title: HRM: Recruitment, Selection & Yield Pyramid
notes.content: Plan sourcing funnel; validity/reliability of selection tools; legal/ethical aspects.
keyTakeaways: Structured interviews outperform unstructured.
Assess utility/cut-scores; monitor adverse impact.
Employer branding affects pipeline quality.

notes.title: Performance Appraisal Methods & Modern Trends
notes.content: Methods: MBO, BARS, 360°, checklists; shift toward coaching/continuous feedback.
keyTakeaways: Choose method by role and measurability.
Mitigate rater errors; separate evaluation from development when needed.
Continuous feedback improves timeliness.

resources.title: SHRM — What You Need to Know (2023)

notes.title: Compensation: Pay Structures & Incentives
notes.content: Base vs. variable pay; internal equity, external competitiveness; pay-for-performance risks.
keyTakeaways: Incentives must align with controllable outcomes.
Use banding & market benchmarks.
Consider intrinsic motivators alongside pay.

notes.title: Porter's Five Forces
notes.content: Industry structure shapes profitability; use to scan threats/opportunities and to guide positioning.
keyTakeaways: Assess all five; avoid firm-level misuse.
Dynamics & tech can alter forces quickly.
Complement with complements/ecosystems view.

notes.title: Core Competence of the Corporation
notes.content: Identify unique, hard-to-imitate capabilities that unlock multiple markets and customer benefits.
keyTakeaways: Three tests: access to markets, customer value, difficult to imitate.
Build portfolios around competencies, not just SBU products.
Invest in capability platforms.

notes.title: Blue Ocean Strategy & Value Innovation
notes.content: Create uncontested market space by shifting the value curve; tools: strategy canvas, four actions.
keyTakeaways: Compete on different factors (eliminate–reduce–raise–create).
Sequence: buyer utility → price → cost → adoption.
Risk reduction via tipping point leadership.

notes.title: Decision-Making: Rational, Bounded, and Behavioral
notes.content: Contrast rational models with heuristics/biases; tools: decision trees, payoff matrices, sensitivity analysis.
keyTakeaways: Use pre-mortems, checklists to mitigate bias.
Consider risk/uncertainty explicitly.
Scenario planning improves robustness.

notes.title: Business Ethics Frameworks
notes.content: Utilitarian, rights, justice, virtue approaches; stakeholder analysis.
keyTakeaways: Map stakeholders & salience.
Integrate ethics into governance and incentives.
Whistleblowing and compliance systems reduce risk.

notes.title: Carroll's Pyramid of CSR & ISO 26000
notes.content: CSR layers (economic, legal, ethical, philanthropic) and ISO guidance on integrating social responsibility.
keyTakeaways: CSR complements, not replaces, profitability.
ISO 26000: principles, core subjects, and integration practices.
Link CSR to ESG metrics and reporting.

notes.title: Channels & Sales Force Management
notes.content: Design channels for coverage, cost, and control; manage salesforce structure, compensation, territories.
keyTakeaways: Conflict management across channels is key.
Hybrid channels require clear governance.
Link sales incentives to customer value, not just volume.

notes.title: Branding & Positioning
notes.content: Craft value proposition; differentiate via attributes/benefits/personality; measure equity.
keyTakeaways: Consistency across touchpoints builds equity.
Position maps visualize competitive space.
Beware line extensions that dilute meaning.

notes.title: Operations Strategy & Capacity
notes.content: Align capacity, layout, and process choice with demand variability and cost priorities.
keyTakeaways: Identify order winners/qualifiers.
Use bottleneck analysis & TOC.
Make vs. buy decisions consider strategic risk.

notes.title: Pakistan Macroeconomic Context (for BA cases)
notes.content: Use current SBP and Finance Division publications for policy, inflation, growth, FX, and sector snapshots.
keyTakeaways: Monetary policy shapes credit cost and investment.
Economic Survey provides sectoral data & trends.
Corporate decisions must reflect local regulatory climate.

notes.title: Corporate Governance in Pakistan
notes.content: Listed Companies Code (2019, amended) + Companies Act 2017 define governance duties, disclosures, board composition.
keyTakeaways: Understand independent directors & audit committee roles.
Disclosure, internal control, and stakeholder rights emphasized.
Non-compliance attracts SECP actions.

resources.title: SECP — Code of Corporate Governance (2019, amended)

notes.title: Pakistan: Competition & Market Conduct
notes.content: Competition Act enforcement, anti-trust norms, and implications for strategy (pricing, channels, mergers).
keyTakeaways: Avoid cartels, predatory pricing, abuse of dominance.
M&A may need clearance; design compliant agreements.
Compliance lowers regulatory risk and reputational damage.

notes.title: Sales Promotion vs. Advertising & IMC
notes.content: Differentiate short-term demand lifts from brand-building; coordinate in IMC plan.
keyTakeaways: Overuse of promotions erodes equity.
Message consistency across media is key.
Measure ROMI and lift vs. baseline.

notes.title: Financial Markets & Capital Budgeting in Exams
notes.content: Know bond/stock basics, cost of capital, WACC; capital budgeting techniques and when each is appropriate.
keyTakeaways: Use WACC consistent with project risk.
Profitability Index helps under capital rationing.
Sensitivity & scenario analysis for risk.

notes.title: Pakistan: Money & Credit, 2024–25 Snapshot
notes.content: Use current monetary/credit aggregates for case data; understand implications for firm financing and consumer demand.
keyTakeaways: Declining policy rates ease borrowing but watch inflation expectations.
Credit growth affects working capital availability.
Exchange rate and reserves shape importers' risk.
